1.text: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, every one who judgest, for in that in which thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

2.text: But we know that the judgment of God is according to truth upon those who do such things.

3.text: And thinkest thou this, O man, who judgest those that do such things, and practisest them [thyself], that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

4.text: or despisest thou the riches of his goodness, and forbearance, and long-suffering, not knowing that the goodness of God leads thee to repentance?

5.text: but, according to thy hardness and impenitent heart, treasurest up to thyself wrath, in [the] day of wrath and revelation of [the] righteous judgment of God,

6.text: who shall render to each according to his works:

7.text: to them who, in patient continuance of good works, seek for glory and honour and incorruptibility, life eternal.

8.text: But to those that are contentious, and are disobedient to the truth, but obey unrighteousness, [there shall be] wrath and indignation,

9.text: tribulation and distress, on every soul of man that works evil, both of Jew first, and of Greek;

10.text: but glory and honour and peace to every one that works good, both to Jew first and to Greek:

11.text: for there is no acceptance of persons with God.

12.text: For as many as have sinned without law shall perish also without law; and as many as have sinned under law shall be judged by law,

13.text: (for not the hearers of the law [are] just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.

14.text: For when [those of the] nations, which have no law, practise by nature the things of the law, these, having no law, are a law to themselves;

15.text: who shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts accusing or else excusing themselves between themselves;)

16.text: in [the] day when God shall judge the secrets of men, according to my glad tidings, by Jesus Christ.

17.text: But if thou art named a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast in God,

18.text: and knowest the will, and discerningly approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;

19.text: and hast confidence that thou thyself art a leader of the blind, a light of those who [are] in darkness,

20.text: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having the form of knowledge and of truth in the law:

21.text: thou then that teachest another, dost thou not teach thyself? thou that preachest not to steal, dost thou steal?

22.text: thou that sayest [man should] not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?

23.text: thou who boastest in law, dost thou by transgression of the law dishonour God?

24.text: For the name of God is blasphemed on your account among the nations, according as it is written.

25.text: For circumcision indeed profits if thou keep [the] law; but if thou be a law-transgressor, thy circumcision is become uncircumcision.

26.text: If therefore the uncircumcision keep the requirements of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be reckoned for circumcision,

27.text: and uncircumcision by nature, fulfilling the law, judge thee, who, with letter and circumcision, [art] a law-transgressor?

28.text: For he is not a Jew who [is] one outwardly, neither that circumcision which is outward in flesh;

29.text: but he [is] a Jew [who is so] inwardly; and circumcision, of the heart, in spirit, not in letter; whose praise [is] not of men, but of God.
